content:
• Tuesday, December 18, 2018
  • GSAT

    Globalstar raising capital; shares down 10%

    • The company is attempting to raise $60M in an equity offering, with underwriter greenshoe for up to another $9M of common stock.
    • Source: Press Release
    • GSAT -9.7% after hours to $0.32.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • ADRO

    MU, FDX & JBL among notable after hour movers

    • Gainers: ADRO +25.9%. JBL +10.3%. SCS +3.3%.
    • Losers: SURF -19.1%. MU -7.0%. FDX -5.9%. CHAP -4.8%. LRCX -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • SAGE

    Sage Therapeutics files for mixed shelf offering

    • Sage Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SAGE) has filed a prospectus for an unspecified mixed shelf offering.
    • Shares are up 2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • SURF

    Surface Oncology shuffles pipeline; cash runway extended; shares down 16% after hours

    • Prompted by a potential safety signal in a Phase 1 trial and a crowded field in CD47 inhibitors, Surface Oncology (NASDAQ:SURF) will significantly reduce its investment in candidate SRF231 while it identifies a better dosing regimen. It plans to release additional data in H2 2019.
    • The company will now deploy resources to advance two preclinical programs, SRF617 and SRF388, into the clinic. It expects to file an IND for the latter by late 2019. The Phase 1 study of NZV930, in collaboration with Novartis, will continue. Its CD39 and IL-27 programs will remain priorities as well.
    • The changes should extend its cash runway through 2021.
    • Shares are down 16% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • JBL

    Jabil +10% on Q1 beats, upside revenue guide

    • Jabil (NYSE:JBL) gains 10.3% after Q1 beats with 17% Y/Y revenue growth. Q2 guidance has upside revenue from $5.8B to $6.4B (consensus: $5.84B) and in-line EPS from $0.51 to $0.71 (consensus: $0.61).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Jabil beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • ADRO

    Aduro Bio out-licenses cGAS-STING inhibitor program to Eli Lilly; shares up 32% after hours

    • Aduro Biotech (NASDAQ:ADRO) is up 32% after hours in response to its licensing deal with Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) for its cGAS-STING Pathway Inhibitor program for the potential treatment of autoimmune and inflammatory disorders.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Aduro will receive $12M upfront, up to $620M in milestones per product and single-to-low-double-digit royalties on net sales. Aduro will also receive research funding and has the option to co-fund development of each product in exchange for higher royalties.
    • STING-related ticker: (NYSE:MRK)
    • Previously: Investors underwhelmed with Aduro's early-stage data on STING candidate; shares down 11% (Nov. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • LRCX

    Micron -7% on mixed Q1, downside guide, capex cut

    • Guidance update: Micron guides Q2 revenue of $5.7B to $6.3B (consensus: $7.18B) and EPS of $1.65 to $1.85 (consensus: $2.45) with NAND and DRAM ships both expected weaker. FY19 capex guided from $9.0B to $9.5B, reduced by $1.25B from the prior guidance.
    • Conference call update: Micron reiterates that SSD will be in a year of transition with share gains expected to resume in 2020.
    • DRAM demand weakened in Q1 with limited near-term visibility. The company thinks some customers carried higher than normal inventory levels and now customers are bringing down the level. Smartphone demand continues to weaken and Micron is seeing the impact of CPU shortages.
    • DRAM bit growth is expected to grow Q/Q going into Q3. Micron lowers its FY19 bit growth guidance to 15% from 20% and plans to significantly reduce capex in the period.
    • NAND bit growth expected at 35% with supply growth exceeding demand in FY19. Company lowers its NAND bit growth estimate and capex for FY19 but expects demand to accelerate in 2H19.
    • Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) and Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) are down 2.8% and 1.9%, respectively, after Micron's capex cuts.
    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) reports Q1 results that beat on EPS but missed on revenue despite a 16% Y/Y revenue growth. Guidance will come on the earnings call scheduled for 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Will update post with information from the call and presentation.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Micron Technology beats by $0.02, misses on revenue (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 323 Comments
  • FDX

    FedEx off nearly 5% after cutting guidance; UPS dips alongside

    • Full-year fiscal 2019 EPS is now seen at $12.65-$13.40 vs. $15.85-$16.45 previously. EPS excluding charges is now guided to $15.50-$16.60 vs. $17.20-$17.80 earlier.
    • At issue is further weakening in international economic conditions and a delay in the realization of benefits from the TNT Express acquisition - operating income boost of $1.2B-$1.5B won't be achieved until fiscal 2020.
    • CFO Alan Graf: "Global trade has slowed in recent months and leading indicators point to ongoing deceleration in global trade near-term."
    • The company is putting in place cost-cutting measures such as a voluntary buyout program for some workers, international network capacity reductions, limited hiring in staff functions, and reductions in discretionary spending.
    • A conference call is set for 5:30 ET.
    • Previously: FedEx beats by $0.09, beats on revenue (Dec. 18)
    • FDX -4.75% after hours, UPS -2.35%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 70 Comments
  • CTIC

    CTI Bio sets protocol for late-stage study of pacritinib in myelofibrosis

    • Incorporating FDA feedback, CTI BioPharma (NASDAQ:CTIC) has clarified the principal design of a Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating pacritinib in adult patients with myelofibrosis who have severe thrombocytopenia (low blood platelets). The primary endpoint will be the proportion of patients who achieve at least a 35% reduction in spleen volume from baseline at week 24.
    • It will also amend the protocol in its Phase 2 PAC203 study to include a Phase 3 component that will enroll ~200 subjects beginning in Q3 2019.
    • The cost of the Phase 3 will be ~$25M. The company says its cash runway should extend into 2020.
    • Shares are down 2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • JBL

    Jabil beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Jabil (NYSE:JBL): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.90 beats by $0.02; GAAP EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $6.51B (+16.5% Y/Y) beats by $410M.
    • Shares +3.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ZS

    Needham: Zscaler heading for $1B in reveneu; ZS +2%

    • Needham reiterates Zscaler (NASDAQ:ZS) at Strong Buy and a $47.50 target after meeting with the company.
    • Analyst Alex Henderson says ZS "is poised to be a major leading cloud security company" and thinks the company can deliver 30% to 50% annual growth over the next five years.
    • Henderson estimates that Zscaler could become a $1B revenue full SaaS cloud security company by 2022/2023 and a $2B company by the following years.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Zscaler shares are up 2.2% to $39.12.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • MRIN

    Technology movers and shakers

    • Gainers: Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) +48%. The Meet Group (NASDAQ:MEET) +16%. Materialise NV (NASDAQ:MTLS) +15%. One Stop Systems (NASDAQ:OSS) +12%. SMART Global Holdings (NASDAQ:SGH) +11%.
    • Losers: OptimizeRx (NASDAQ:OPRX) -17%. The9 Limited (NASDAQ:NCTY) -16%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) -13%. Plug Power (NASDAQ:PLUG) -10%. Inpixon (NASDAQ:INPX) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • ARW

    Arrow Electronics amends its credit facility

    • Arrow Electronics (ARW +0.8%) amends its revolving credit facility, extending the maturity to December 2023 and capacity to $2B from the previous December 2021 and $1.8B.
    • ARW is up 1% to $70.56.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • SNAP

    Snap hardware unit gets (another) new boss

    • Snap's (NYSE:SNAP) SnapLab hardware unit will have Steen Strand as its new boss in February, according to Recode. Strand, an Icon Aircraft vet, will be the unit's fourth boss in a little over a year.
    • VP of hardware development Sahil Sharma is leaving the company after joining in July to replace departing head Mark Randall.
    • Snap is reportedly working on a third version of its Spectacles, which were thought to arrive before the end of the year.
    • Snap shares are up 3.9% to $5.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 14 Comments
  • MBII

    Commodities among Energy/Materials gainers

    • Gainers: Marrone Bio Innovations (NASDAQ:MBII) +8%. Alamos Gold (NYSE:AGI) +8%. Mountain Province Diamonds (NYSEMKT:MPVD) +6%. Approach Resources (NASDAQ:AREX) +5%. Universal Stainless & Alloy Products (NASDAQ:USAP) +5%.
    • Losers: BP Prudhoe Bay Royalty Trust (NYSE:BPT) -14%. NCS Multistage Holdings (NASDAQ:NCSM) -13%. Rosehill  Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) -12%. Blueknight Energy Partners (NASDAQ:BKEP) -11%. Lonestar Resources US (NASDAQ:LONE) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • MU

    Chips gain on Luxtera acquisition, Micron earnings

    • Chip stocks gain with the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index up 2.2% after Cisco announced plans to acquire Luxtera. Micron (MU +2.1%) will report earnings after the close today.
    • Barclays analyst Blayne Curtis says the purchase could prove negative for Macom (MTSI +2.3%), which counts Cisco as the lead customer for its PSM4 solution and that MTSI doesn't seem to have much traction outside of Cisco on the product.
    • Curtis sees the acquisition as a modest long-term negative for Inphi (IPHI +2.1%) and says it could put pressure on Intel (INTC +1.8%) and Maxim Integrated (MXIM +0.5%).
    • B. Riley's Dave Kang sees the acquisition as negative for Finisar (FNSR +0.9%) and Applied Optoelectronics (AAOI -8.6%).
    • Previously: Cisco will acquire Luxtera for $660M (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 8 Comments
  • WPG

    Washington Prime sinks after Goldman downgrades to sell

    • Washington Prime Group (WPG -8.1%) slumps after Goldman Sachs cuts rating to sell from neutral.
    • Price target cut to $4.30 from $6.60.
    • Earlier WPG touched $5.25, a new 52-week low.
    • Mall REITs CBL (CBL -10.2%) and Pennsylvania REIT (PEI -4.5%) also sink. All three REITs have exposure to Sears, which has a bankruptcy hearing today.
    • Previously: CBL seen most at risk, Macerich in best position post-Sears bankruptcy (Oct. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 83 Comments
  • APHA

    Aphria up 10% on positive Citron report

    • Pot stock Aphria (APHA +9.9%) is up on almost 7M shares on the heels of a bullish report from Citron Research who says the stock could jump 33% to $8 by month-end.
    • Citron says the company sports an attractive valuation ($1.5B) relative to peers Cronos Group (CRON +4.2%) ($2.1B), Canopy Growth (CGC) ($10.7B), Aurora Cannabis (ACB +1.1%) ($5.6B) and Tilray (TLRY +17.8%) ($7.3B) and may be an acquisition target.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 62 Comments
  • SGH

    Smart Global +11% on joining S&P SmallCap 600

    • Smart Global (NASDAQ:SGH) gains 10.9% on news the company will join the S&P SmallCap 600 Index, effective December 24.
    • Smart Global will replace XO Group, which is being acquired by WeddingWire.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • EVER

    EverQuote leads financial gainers; eXp World Holdings and Washington Prime Group among losers

    • Gainers: EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) +8%. Mesabi Trust (NYSE:MSB) +7%. Shore Bancshares (NASDAQ:SHBI) +7%. Ashford Hospitality Trust (NYSE:AHT) +7%. Owens Realty Mortgage (NYSEMKT:ORM) +5%.
    • Losers: B. Riley Financial (NASDAQ:RILY) -9%. Washington Prime Group (NYSE:WPG) -8%. eXp World Holdings (NASDAQ:EXPI) -7%. CBL & Associates Properties (NYSE:CBL) -7%. CNFinance Holdings (NYSE:CNF) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • MRIN

    Healthcare & Tech leads midday movers

    • Gainers: Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) +45%. HyreCar (NASDAQ:HYRE) +26%. The Lovesac (NASDAQ:LOVE) +19%. Electrameccanica Vehicles (NASDAQ:SOLO) +17%. The Meet Group (NASDAQ:MEET) +16%. Tyme Technologies (NASDAQ:TYME) +12%. Diebold Nixdorf (NYSE:DBD) +12%. Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY) +12%. Materialise NV (NASDAQ:MTLS) +11%. SMART Global Holdings (NASDAQ:SGH) +11%.
    • Losers: Nemaura Medical (NASDAQ:NMRD) -39%. AxoGen (NASDAQ:AXGN) -27%. Xcel Brands (NASDAQ:XELB) -24%. Aileron Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALRN) -23%. Dova Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DOVA) -22%. Microbot Medical (NASDAQ:MBOT) -21%. NF Energy Saving (NASDAQ:NFEC) -19%. ContraFect (NASDAQ:CFRX) -19%. Diffusion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DFFN) -18%. Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) -16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • AXGN

    AxoGen down 27% on bearish SA article

    • AxoGen (AXGN -27%) slumps on triple normal on the heels of an article published today on Seeking Alpha by Seligman Investments saying its cadaver-sourced nerve grafts are over-hyped, citing modest revenues of $78M 11 years post-launch in an addressable market valued at $2.7B.
    • Seligman believes the company's fair value target is $5.07, almost 75% below the current price of $19.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALRN

    Aileron continues selloff, down 24%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Aileron Therapeutics (ALRN -23.8%) continues its downward fall on more than triple normal volume. Shares have lost over 60% of their value this month.
    • Lead candidate is ALRN-6924, in Phase 1 or 2 development for a range of solid tumors and blood cancers.
    • On the working capital front, at the end of September it had $27.9M in quick assets while operations consumed $21.3M during the first three quarters of the year.
    • The company is currently selling for less than the $1.90 cash value per share at the end of Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • NAVI

    Navient must face state suit on `predatory' student loans: Bloomberg

    • Navient Corp. (NASDAQ:NAVI) must face a lawsuit filed by the state of Pennsylvania alleging "deceptive practices and predatory conduct," Bloomberg reports.
    • Navient -0.8% in midday trading.
    • The biggest servicer of U.S. student loans will have to face claims that it violated consumer protection laws by steering struggling borrowers into payment plans that benefited the company rather than the students, according to a ruling late Monday by U.S. District Judge Robert Mariani in Scranton.
    • Navient's earlier motions to dismiss the claims failed in three similar cases.
    • Previously: Barclays trims its Navient target (Dec. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • LOVE

    Lovesac jumps +11% on Q3 result beats

    • The Lovesac (LOVE +11.1%) reported Q3 sales growth of 70.9% Y/Y to $41.7M, driven by strong showroom, Internet and shop-in-shop performance.
    • Combined Comparable sales increased 51.0% Y/Y, with comparable showroom sales +40.5% Y/Y and Internet sales +93.9% Y/Y.
    • Q3 Gross margin declined by 113 bps to 54.9% and operating loss increased 30.5% Y/Y to $2.7M.
    • Company reported Adj. EBITDA loss of $392k, compared to $778k a year ago.
    • SG&A expenses increased 59.8% Y/Y to $19.33M and margin declined by 322 bps to 46.4%.
    • Net cash used in operating activities YTD was $14.22M, compared to $9.49M a year ago.
    • Company has Cash and cash equivalents of $44.68M as of November 4, 2018.
    • Previously: Lovesac beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • SOLO

    Navistar International among consumer gainers; Orchids Paper Products and SORL Auto Parts among losers

    • Gainers: Electrameccanica Vehicles (NASDAQ:SOLO) +16%. Navistar International (NYSE:NAV) +11%. The Lovesac (NASDAQ:LOVE) +10%. Calyxt (NASDAQ:CLXT) +7%. Farmmi (NASDAQ:FAMI) +7%.
    • Losers: Xcel Brands (NASDAQ:XELB) -23%. Ballantyne Strong (NYSEMKT:BTN) -12%. Seneca Foods (NASDAQ:SENEA) -8%. SORL Auto Parts (NASDAQ:SORL) -6%. Orchids Paper Products (NYSEMKT:TIS) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharma up 5% on Endo deal for generic Sabril

    • Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (CPRX +4.9%) is up on average volume in reaction to its agreement with Endo International (ENDP -0.1%) to develop and commercialize its generic version of Lundbeck's (OTCPK:HLUYY +2.6%) epilepsy med Sabril (vigabatrin) through its Par Pharmaceutical unit.
    • Under the terms of the contract, CPRX will receive an upfront payment, milestones and a share of the profits when commercialized. Specific financial terms are not disclosed.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 14 Comments
  • GT

    Goodyear Tire & Rubber to expand capacity at Slovenian facility

    • Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT +1.6%) announces plans to expand its manufacturing facility in Slovenia to meet the growing demand for premium tires in the Europe/Middle East/Asia business.
    • "The demand for premium, larger-rim-diameter consumer tires is growing across EMEA. To ensure the sustainable growth of our business, Goodyear plans to invest €94 million in its plant in Kranj, Slovenia to increase its capacity in this profitable segment," says Gooyear VP Henry Dumortier.
    • Goodyear's Vice President Consumer Europe.
    • The investment will help increase the plant's overall capacity by approximately 25% to allow for production of an additional 1.8M premium, A segment consumer tires annually.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • BIIB

    Biogen down 5%, sell-siders soften outlook

    • Biogen (BIIB -5.3%) is down on average volume, almost completing a round turn from a brief rally that began in October.
    • This quarter, Oppenheimer, RBC and JPMorgan all lowered their price targets (although two of three maintain their Buy ratings). Bernstein is the most bearish, citing patent risks for Tecfidera and potentially futile results for Alzheimer's candidate aducanumab that could drive the stock down to the $100 range.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 9 Comments
  • AMBA

    Analyst positive on Ambarella's Hella deal; AMBA +3%

    • Morgan Stanley analyst Joseph Moore says Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) deal with Hella to deliver a platform for next-gen advanced driver assistance systems has substantial strategic value and "will take on Mobileye (NASDAQ:INTC) for 2021 model year and beyond."
    • Moore says it will take time for this to drive revenue growth, but he expects strength in the auto segment in the interim.
    • AMBA remains the firm's favorite small cap idea, despite recent pressures.
    • Rating maintained at Overweight with a $50 target.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • AMBA shares are up 3% to $38.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • APRN

    Blue Apron drops below $1

    • Shares of Blue Apron (APRN -8%) slip below $1 for the first and traded as low as $0.884 earlier in the session.
    • Blue Apron is now trading below even the lowest price target set by Wall Street analysts.
    • The meal kit provider priced its IPO at $10 per share last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • TLRY

    Tilray and Equillium among healthcare gainers; ContraFect and Diffusion Pharmaceuticals among losers

    • Gainers: CollPlant Holdings (NASDAQ:CLGN) +14%. Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY) +9%. Equillium (NASDAQ:EQ) +8%. Kodiak Sciences (NASDAQ:KOD) +5%. Tyme Technologies (NASDAQ:TYME) 5%.
    • Losers: Nemaura Medical (NASDAQ:NMRD) -39%. ContraFect (NASDAQ:CFRX) -25%. Aileron Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALRN) -24%. Champions Oncology (NASDAQ:CSBR) -19%. Diffusion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DFFN) -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 27 Comments
  • HEI

    Heico up 6% on Q4 result beats

    • Heico (HEI +6%) reported Q4 net sales growth of 13.2% Y/Y to $476.88M. Sales by segments: Flight support group $290.25M (+13% Y/Y) and Electronic technologies group $191.08M (+13.02% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Operating margin improved by 50 bps to 21.7%.
    • EBITDA increased by 14.6% Y/Y to $123.31M and margin improved by 31 bps to 25.9%.
    • Flight support group operating margin improved by 70 bps to 18.8% and Electronic technologies group declined by 26 bps to 29.9%.
    • SG&A expenses increased by 17.3% Y/Y to $82.76M.
    • Net cash provided by operating activities YTD was $328.49M, compared to $288.28M a year ago.
    • Company has Cash and cash equivalents of $59.59M as of October 31, 2018.
    • FY19 Guidance: Net sales growth 8-10%; net income ~10% growth; operating margin ~21-21.5%; Capex ~$48M and cash flow from operations ~$360M.
    • Previously: HEICO declares $0.07 dividend (Dec. 17)
    • Previously: HEICO beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Dec. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • HMNY

    Helios & Matheson Analytics updates on note exchange

    • Helios & Matheson Analytics (NASDAQ:HMNY) discloses an exchange of the remaining amount payable on its $18.8M November convertible notes and its $25.7 million January convertible note for about $11.3M in new non-convertible Series B senior notes.
    • SEC Form 8-K
    • HMNY trades at $0.02.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Bernstein bull lowers Netflix target

    • Bernstein analyst Todd Juenger maintains an Outperform rating for Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) but lowers the target from $465 to $421.
    • The analyst is grappling with the "especially tough question" of what's already priced into the stock, saying the market is no longer buying into the idea that higher programming spend is necessary to build subscribers.
    • Juenger remains positive on subscriber numbers beating expectations.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Netflix shares are up 2% to $268.01.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 16 Comments
  • TER

    Teradyne +4% on Northland initiation

    • Northland Securities starts Teradyne (NYSE:TER) at Market Perform with a $35 price target, a 10% upside to yesterday's close.
    • Analyst Gus Richard says the company is "a leading supplier of semiconductor test equipment and an emerging supplier of industrial robots."
    • The analyst expects 1H19 weakness on inventory correction but a strong 5G product cycle moving into CY20.
    • The firm thinks Teradyne's CAGR will accelerate into the low-double digits in CY20 and beyond.
    • Teradyne shares are up 4.3% to $33.15.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • NAV

    Navistar results spark rally

    • Navistar (NAV +18.8%) soars after strong results and a confident outlook for 2019 brings investors rushing back in.
    • Analysts are pointing in particular to the impressive 20% jump in adjusted EBITDA during the quarter and solid backlog of orders heading into next year.
    • Riding on the coattails of Navistar are PACCAR (PCAR +2%), Oshkosh (OSK +3%), Meritor (MTOR +3.2%), Cummins (CMI +1.6%), Allison Transmission (ALSN +2.7%), WABCO (WBC +1.5%) and Wabash National (WNC +3.1%).
    • Previously: Navistar strikes gains in FQ4 (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • TAK

    Takeda at 52-week low after Moody's downgrade; shares down 5%

    • Takeda Pharmaceutical Company (TKPYY -4.6%) is down on light volume in early trade. Shares are currently exchanging hands at a 52-week low as it advances its planned $62B takeout of Shire plc, expected to close in the next few weeks.
    • Yesterday, Moody's downgraded its credit rating to Baa2 with a stable outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Stocks gain strongly after blue Monday

    • U.S. stock markets start strongly, led by industrial goods (+1.6%), tech (+1.1%), and financial (+1.0%).
    • S&P 500 1.1%, Nasdaq +1.1%, Dow +1.4%.
    • Individual names gaining include Amazon (AMZN +1.8%), Alphabet (GOOG +1.6%), Boeing (BA +4.8%), Bank of America (BAC +2.4%).
    • J&J (JNJ +1%) rebounds as it announces a $5B stock buyback; follows a sharp two-day decline on a Reuters story alleging asbestos was found in the company's baby powder.
    • Oracle (ORCL +3.8%) gains after providing better-than-expected Q3 guidance.
    • Crude falls 3.1% to $48.36; prices drop to a 14-month low.
    • U.S. dollar index falls 0.2% to 96.98.
    • U.S. 10-year Treasury bid up, pushing yield down almost 1 basis point to 2.85%; 2-year Treasury yield also down almost 1 basis point at 2.687%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 31 Comments
  • KODK

    FTC grants antitrust clearance for Flexographic Packaging Division sale

    • Kodak (KODK +1%) received FTC clearance for the sale of their Flexographic Packaging Division to PE firm Montagu Private Equity.
    • Kodak intends to use the proceeds from the sale to reduce long-term debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • OPRX

    OptimizeRx prices equity offering; shares down 16% premarket

    • OptimizeRx (NASDAQ:OPRX) prices its public offering of ~2.1M common shares from a current investor at $10 per share. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional ~316K shares. Closing date is December 20.
    • The company will receive no proceeds from the sales.
    • Shares are down 16% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • CRBP

    Corbus Pharma up 3% premarket on new lenabasum patent

    • Corbus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CRBP) is up 3% premarket on light volume in reaction to the issuance of a new U.S. composition of matter patent covering the use of lenabasum in a range of inflammatory and fibrotic diseases.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • MEET

    Meet Group +2.4% on Battles rollout, Nov. vid rev

  • TSLA

    Tesla takes from Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs

    • Morgan Stanley sees the rally in Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) running out of steam shortly.
    • "While we acknowledge the significance of Tesla’s very strong 3Q result, we do not believe investors will assume the company is fully self-sufficient without a more sustained period of execution," writes analyst Adam Jonas.
    • Jonas points to the ongoing concerns with Tesla's business in China and the European Union, while warning on an "emerging peak" in investor sentiment.
    • Also weighing today on Tesla is the Goldman Sachs team, reiterating the firm's Sell rating and pointing once again to the new EV competition that Tesla faces.
    • Shares of Tesla are up 0.84% in premarket action to $351.35 and are up 12% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 122 Comments

    Tilray up 13% premarket on Sandoz partnership

    • Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY) is up 13% premarket on light volume in reaction to its announced collaboration with Novartis' (NYSE:NVS) Sandoz unit to globally commercialize Tilray's non-smokable/non-combustible medical cannabis products. Financial terms are not disclosed.

  • NSPR

    InspireMD up 11% premarket on new data supporting CGuard EPS

    • Nano cap InspireMD (NYSEMKT:NSPR) is up 11% premarket on light volume on the heels of new metadata supporting the value proposition of its MicroNet-covered CGuard Embolic Prevention System (EPS).
    • Results from an analysis four clinical trials involving dual-layered and mesh-covered stents showed that carotid artery disease (CAD) patients who received mesh-covered stents experienced a 30-day minor stroke rate of 1.25%, lower than two widely cited studies in patients treated with both carotid endarterectomy (surgical plaque removal) and conventional carotid stents. In addition, the four studies involved a higher proportion of high-risk and elderly patients.
    • CEO James Barry, Ph.D. says, “The compelling results of this independent and comprehensive meta-analysis, which includes four studies of high-risk patients treated for carotid artery disease, add to the growing body of evidence that points to superior clinical outcomes with next generation mesh-covered or dual layered devices versus their conventional carotid stent counterparts. As we continue to expand the commercial availability of our MicroNet™-covered product, CGuard™ EPS, including the submission of a U.S. IDE expected in mid-2019, we welcome additional analyses such as these that further support the positive findings from our own studies with MicroNet-covered products.”
     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • BIOC

    Biocept and Prognos teams up to apply artificial intelligence for commercialization of biomarker-targeted therapies in oncology

    • Biocept (NASDAQ:BIOC) has entered into a Software License and Laboratory Data Supply Agreement with Prognos, Inc.
    • Under the agreement, Biocept will supply de-identified data from its liquid biopsy testing to Prognos, to help its clients ensure that the right patients receive the right therapies.
    • Biocept will utilize Prognos' Opal de-identification software to collect and transmit the data to Prognos.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.
    • BIOC shares are up 31% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 2 Comments

  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharma up 5% premarket on positive LX9211 data

    • Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) is up 5% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1a clinical trial evaluating neuropathic pain candidate LX9211.
    • The study met its primary objectives, demonstrating a favorable safety and tolerability profile and identifying the maximum tolerated dose.
    • The most common adverse event was headache.
    • A multiple ascending-dose study should launch next quarter.
    • Small molecule LX9211 inhibits an enzyme called adaptor-associated protein kinase 1 (AAK1). The company acquired exclusive rights from development partner Bristol-Myers Squibb two years ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM

  • DRI

    Darden lifts profit guidance

    • Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) edges EPS estimates with its FQ2 earnings report on total sales growth of 4.9%.
    • Darden reports comparable sales were up 3.5% during the quarter, off a 1.9% gain in pricing and 2.4% positive contribution from menu-mix. Same-restaurant traffic was down 0.8%.
    • Comparable sales by chain: Olive Garden +3.5% vs. +3.4% consensus, LongHorn +2.9%, +3.7% Capital Grille, +0.9% Eddie V's, -4.0% Cheddar Scratch Kitchen, -1.1% Yard House, -0.8% Seasons 52, -1.1% Bahama Breeze.
    • Looking ahead, Darden expects same-restaurant sales growth of 2.5% in FY19 and EPS of $5.60 to $5.70 vs. $5.52 to $5.65 prior and $5.65 consensus.
    • DRI +0.15% premarket to $98.91
    • Previously: Darden Restaurants beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (Dec. 18)
